title: Svetlana Jitomirskaya
summary: Svetlana Yakovlevna Jitomirskaya (born June 4, 1966) is a Soviet-born American mathematician working on dynamical systems and mathematical physics.[1][2] She is a distinguished professor of mathematics at the University of California, Irvine.[3] She is best known for solving the ten martini problem along with mathematician Artur Avila.[4][5]
